This report marks our first disclosure of Scope 1 and Scope 2 
Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions. Emissions sources include 
stationary combustion and refrigerants for our Scope 1 GHG emissions 
and purchased electricity for our Scope 2 GHG emissions. Following our 
analysis, we purchased carbon offsets to offset the entirety of our Scope 
1 GHG emissions and renewable energy certificates to offset the entirety 
of our Scope 2 GHG emissions. We intend to continue to offset our 
Scope 1 and 2 emissions going forward, while also evaluating measures to 
reduce GHG emissions over time. We utilized 2019 as our baseline year, 
as it was the last full year unaffected by the COVID-19 pandemic.
The chart below shows 2019 and 2021 GHG emissions data and 
accompanying energy consumption data for our corporate offices. 
Purchased electricity comprised virtually all of AGNC’s total Scope 1 
and Scope 2 GHG emissions. AGNC began to re-open corporate offices 
in July 2021, and, as such, we anticipate that 2021 GHG emissions are 
likely artificially low as a result.  We would expect more normalized 
levels in 2022 following our full office opening in March 2022.
